ygData.subject: Re: Pelts and Tailoring
ygData.msgSnippet: Is reinforced leather better than snakeskin armor of the same piece, i.e. is snakeskin arms better than reinforced arms? If not, then snakeskin is the way to
ygData.messageBody:
Is reinforced leather better than snakeskin armor of the same piece, i.e. is
snakeskin arms better than reinforced arms?

If not, then snakeskin is the way to go. You get + vs poison, and it's
fairly easy to get in Blackburrow, or Split paw, can't remember which one,
but you could go there for about a week, and have close to a whole set. Our
druid did it, with a friend to help, and they had it in 3 days.

Wenaddar


> -----Original Message-----
> From: A. Berg [SMTP:anberg@...]
> Sent: Thursday, June 24, 1999 10:23 AM
> To: EQCheats@onelist.com
> Subject: Re: [EQCheats] Pelts and Tailoring
>
> From: "A. Berg" <anberg@...>
>
> At 10:07 24.6.1999 EDT, you wrote:
> >From: PRIMEhero@...
> >
> > This is all well and good for medium wearers. And it is fairly well
> >known that the other Karanas yield decent LQ, MQ, and HQ Bear pelts for
> the
> >larger types (as well as the Kodiaks to the East). However, with several
> >hundred puppies that have gotten their noses whacked I find no good
> source
> of
> >LQ, MQ, or HQ pelts for small sizes.
> > And while on the subject, any use for LQ pelts besides resale for
> >coin? Tailors use MQ (studded) and HQ (Reinforced, which last I heard
> wasn't
> >working). LQ uses?
> >
>
> I found that to get any quality wolf pelts it's best to kill the wolves in
> Qeynos hills. I had never gotten anything other than a ruined pelt or some
> sort of skin before I tried the wolves there, in just a few hours I had
> several HQ and med wolf pelts. Reinforced does work, it's only one or two
> points of ac better than leather but I have successfully made a few
> pieces.
> As to low quality pelts, there is a quest that uses bear and wolf pelts of
> low quality in QH but that's it. Does anyone have any tips for me on where
> it is best to get HQ bear pelts? I have killed countless bears for a very
> long time and have only gotten my hands on 4 HQ bear pelts to work with.
> And two of those I got lucky and found and bought from a store.
>
> A. Berg
>
